comments.body: You are right. It should.
This should apply to all armor. It's annoying to have to open your inventory to swap which armor you're using.
I agree bc my chest of enchanted books keeps getting full and I normally use enchants for the cool design

How would this work? Would different kinds of enchanted book stack together, in which case it would be impossible to find the one you're looking for, or would they only stack if the have the same enchantments, which is very rare and wouldn't give you that much extra space. Overall, if you have that many enchanted books, you can probably afford to make a few extra chests.
Sorry about that. I meant to say you should be able to stack the same enchanted books.
Yeah we all knew that’s what you were actually saying no worries :)
This post needs way more attention
I don't think they should affect damage and speed, just size and maybe jump height. They should be only possible to get with endgame loot, maybe from stuff in the End

love this, but maybe instead you could knock it in a different direction? or maybe you could do that with swords. if you're in pvp, and someone throws an ender pearl at you to close in, you can hit it and knock it in a different direction, meaning they end up in a different spot, so long as you react quick enough

UnbakedQuasar42
That wouldn't make sense because the ender Pearl was designed to teleport when it touches something so it would teleport on contact with the bow

This feature would be very nice for trick shots and saves. This also makes sense because when an ender pearl collides with a player or mob, it activates, so an ender pearl colliding with an arrow should also activate it. I think you should take some of the damage the arrow would normally deal along with any potion effect if it was a tipped arrow. This could add more purpose to things like slow falling arrows, as you would want to hit your own ender pearls with slow falling to prevent fall damage and softly land back down. Arrows activating ender pearls provides a good counter to seeing someone ender pearl away, but it requires a good amount of skill to make use of. You can use it offensively to stop someone from rushing or escaping with an ender pearl. You can also use it defensibly if you need to activate an ender pearl early, such as if you were to fall or get knocked off a cliff/mountain. With fast enough reactions, you could launch an ender pearl and snipe it with a crossbow to get your height back, and it would probably look amazing. I think this feature would allow for more skillful use around ender pearls, and I really hope it gets added to Minecraft.
Agreed. However, if you die on stone or any block that doesn't primarily break on shovels (except netherrack), it will despawn. Also, leaves can have the same mechanic, but with shears.

HOWEVER it will not store the items in that place, but rather if you brush away dirt just about anywhere you will have a small chance of finding one of your respawned non-consumable items, though they will lose durability over time until they really are just gone forever. You have a bigger chance of finding these items in river or beach biomes.

You have a bigger chance of finding these items in river or beach biomes.

When you throw an egg there is a 1 in 8 chance to get a chicken and a really tiny chance to get four.
yes like a chest boat but barrelier.

Given the aquatic update... adding a "fishing boat" ( with storage, and the space to add a "room/bed" ) would make "living at sea" a very cool part of the game.

I would imagine a "moving bed" might be a bit of a difficulty for the "spawn point mechanics". Though it would be a great way to explore the world without needing to make more beds an mini-houses all over the maps too.
I personally think they’re already a bit powerful they don’t need to be more as it showed it’s intended for early game, a bit too powerful if anything.

For large projects, there are the Shulker Box and Ender Chests.

But, it would be interesting if there are Bundles of different levels, something like the ones that villagers have when leveling up. From 32, 64 and 128 max, more would be quite unbalanced.
Or maybe yes, but very very difficult to find, even more so than enchanted apples.
I think a shulker box full of bundles will be very useful
The upgrades for the bundles would probably require diamond or emerald blocks. To not be way to powerful
I feel that a single Bundle should be able to carry up to 3-4 stacks of items.

I was thinking of the enchantment idea. With two levels with (the enchantment name)I giving you +32 space and (the enchantment name)II giving you +64 bundle space. This should be a treasure or villager enchantment and not something from the enchantment table
YES  are invintorys are bing  NERFT now a wopping 75% is taken up by things you cant stack or 64 packs we need bundels to hold mor than 64
I actually like the item cap in bundles, but I would love to be able to reach into a bundle and take an item of choice, not just the 'last' item in.

Honestly I think just increasing the default bundle size is fine, but maybe restricting the number you can carry at once and only allowing empty bundles in storage. I've found them pretty useful for managing my inventory but if it had 256 slots at most, they'd be perfect

I was wary of the usefulness of bundles when I first heard about them, but actually using them makes me realize how useful they are. All those times I went mining in pre-bundle times, I'd be stuck with small amounts of stackables, like different ores and flowers, but now I can merge together any stackables into a bundle. This has greatly extended my mining trips.

Also this is the most powerful when it comes to carrying things like maps, before if you wanted to carry umpteen different maps, your best solution was bringing a shulker box, but now this is where bundle as actually even more powerful than a shulker box, being able to carry 64 different maps as opposed to 27! Maybe you wanna start a variety farm or something, and you can put in all different crop/seed/vine/tree types into one bundle for easy packaging, could have 64 different types of growables in 1 bundle (idk if there's even that many kinds).

It's not too powerful but it has a definite advantage over shulker box, being able to consolidate different stackables into 1 slot. Only improvement would be the ability to pick a specific item out instead of the last one, or just dropping all. I don't think it needs an expansion, as useful as that sounds to have, it would be stepping on shulker box too much.

One last thing, I initially dreaded getting the materials for making bundles because rabbits are semi rare and hard to catch, but it took me a long while to realize that cats can gift you string and rabbit hides!

Yes! All I want is GYROSCOPE. I don’t know why they’re not looking for this. Its yr2020 and mobile gaming is on another level and has changed a lot. I play Minecraft on my iPad and it’s way harder than playing on mobile because i have to split my controls to crosshairs mode cuz i can’t strech my thumb to the middle every time. While playing with crosshairs it’s harder to jump and hit the moving target simultaneously and Also definitely you can’t do any parkour moves as mouse&keyboard users do. Gyroscope would definitely help smoothing the gameplay and gives touch players whole new experience.

I would like a driftwood that is gray, and can make everything that wood can make, and is able to be created by the player. 

driftwood is created by placing any wood logs in the water. Once they age (similar time to copper aging) they become driftwood. driftwood can be found as part of shipwrecks, or as random structures and logs on coastal biomes and under water. 

driftwood is a gray color, maybe brown gray. 

driftwood can be from any wood, once it turns to driftwood it can have multiple ages, dark, medium, and very light. driftwood cannot be stripped to return to original aging, but can be waxed to prevent aging if driftwood blox are placed in water. 

 

driftwood boats are faster
